XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR Because PRAS40 displays pro survival XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR and pro tumorigenic XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR activity through an unknown mechanism , we hypothesized that PRAS40 negatively regulates p53 through association with RPL11 and inhibition of the RPL11-HDM2-p53 pathway . ++++ Importantly , re-introduction of WT PRAS40 completely rescues this effect , whereas RPL11 binding-null PRAS40 T246A fails to do so ( XREF_FIG ) , indicating that the ability of PRAS40 to suppress p53 is dependent upon the capacity of PRAS40 to associate with RPL11 . ++++ PRAS40 depletion induces p53 protein stability in an RPL11 dependent manner . ++++ Taken together , our results suggest that PRAS40 negatively regulates p53 stability and activity by inhibiting the RPL11-HDM2 pathway in a manner dependent upon PRAS40-RPL11 association , thereby helping to suppress p53 mediated induction of senescence in unstressed cells . ++++ PRAS40 negatively regulates p53 dependent transcriptional activity and senescence . ++++ This provides further support for the hypothesis that PRAS40 negatively regulates p53 through inhibition of the RPL11-HDM2 pathway .
PRAS40 negatively regulates p53 dependent transcriptional activity and senescence . ++++ While we are not able to detect significant induction of cell death in U2OS cells , PRAS40 depletion significantly increases senescence associated beta-galactosidase activity compared to NS control cells .

This finding suggests that inhibition of mTORC1 activity alone is sufficient to disrupt the nuclear PRAS40- and RPL11 containing complex .
Because PRAS40 is an established negative regulator of mTORC1 , we sought to test whether PRAS40 KD induced mTORC1 activation contributes to p53 upregulation .
PRAS40 is a major target of both Akt and mTORC1 and , as such , is used extensively as a biomarker for development of PI3K-Akt and mTORC1 pathway inhibitors .
Specifically , when ribosome production is disturbed , RPL11 translocates from the nucleoli to the nucleoplasm where it binds and inhibits the p53 directed E3 ubiquitin ligase HDM2 , resulting in increased p53 protein stability and transcriptional activity .

In agreement with our transient transfection studies , Dox induced PRAS40 KD results in p53 and p21 upregulation compared to NS control cells ( XREF_FIG ) .
Taken together , these results indicate that PRAS40 KD induces p53 protein stabilization in an RPL11 dependent manner and imply that PRAS40 may act as an endogenous regulator of the RPL11-HDM2-p53 pathway .
Specifically , when ribosome production is disturbed , RPL11 translocates from the nucleoli to the nucleoplasm where it binds and inhibits the p53 directed E3 ubiquitin ligase HDM2 , resulting in increased p53 protein stability and transcriptional activity .
Because p53 is a critical mediator of cell fate , it is subject to multiple layers of regulation , including transcriptional , translational , and post-translational mechanisms .
XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR This enables activation of a transcription program promoting cell cycle arrest , senescence , or apoptosis .

XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR Because our results imply that PRAS40 is a negative regulator of the RPL11-HDM2 pathway that suppresses p53 dependent senescence , it is plausible that upregulation of PRAS40 is one mechanism by which cancer cells overcome the tumor suppressive effects of oncogene induced p53 .

The Ribosomal Protein ( RP )-HDM2-p53 pathway has been shown to play key roles in oncogene induced apoptosis and senescence , but the mechanism regulating this pathway remains elusive .
PRAS40 accumulates in the nuclei of cells treated with LMB , but not vehicle control , suggesting that PRAS40 subcellular localization is controlled at least in part by active , dynamic nucleocytoplasmic shuttling ( XREF_FIG ) .
Taken together , our results suggest that PRAS40 negatively regulates p53 stability and activity by inhibiting the RPL11-HDM2 pathway in a manner dependent upon PRAS40-RPL11 association , thereby helping to suppress p53 mediated induction of senescence in unstressed cells .

Collectively , besides ATM and ATR , the activity of Chk2 kinase is also required for DBC1 mediated SIRT1 inhibition , ensuing acetylation and activation of p53 , and finally apoptosis . ++++ The potential role played by REGgamma in DBC1 dependent inhibition of SIRT1 was analyzed in DBC1 overexpressing U2OS cells transfected with siRNA against REGgamma or a control sequence , and the results showed that REGgamma depletion reduces the DBC1 dependent increase in p53 acetylation . ++++ Here , we report that catalytically active Chk2 is required for DBC1 mediated SIRT1 deacetylase inhibition and p53 dependent apoptosis . ++++ Here , we report that the inhibition of SIRT1 by DBC1 in the DNA damage response ( DDR ) also depends on Chk2 , the transducer kinase that is activated by ATM upon DNA lesions and contributes to the spreading of DNA damage signal . ++++ SIRT1 inhibition by DBC1 is REGgamma dependent . ++++ Collectively these data suggest that REGgamma-Ser247 phosphorylation promotes its association with DBC1 and contributes to the DBC1 mediated inhibition of SIRT1 . ++++ Moreover , when we overexpressed REGgamma WT or REGgamma S247A in control or Chk2 silenced U2OS cells , we detected an increase in p53 acetylation , upon etoposide , only with the ectopic wild-type protein and in Chk2 proficient cells , clearly indicating that SIRT1 inhibition by DBC1 requires REGgamma phosphorylated on S247 by Chk2 .
To determine whether Chk2 inhibition has the same effect on DBC1-SIRT1 regulation as Chk2 knockdown , experiments were performed in U2OS cells overexpressing DBC1 that , prior to etoposide exposure , were pre-treated with VRX0466617 ( hereafter referred to VRX ) , a selective inhibitor of Chk2 . ++++ To verify that this event is not caused by Chk2 dependent induction of SIRT1 protein , possibly mediated by HuR , we performed western blot analysis of control and Chk2 depleted cells expressing ectopic DBC1 , but no significant differences in SIRT1 protein levels were found among samples .
To further investigate the mechanism underlying REGgamma mediated DBC1 dependent SIRT1 inhibition , we analyzed DBC1 and SIRT1 complex in REGgamma silenced cells .
The 11S proteasome activator REGgamma binds and activates the catalytic function of the 20S proteasome , promotes the ubiquitin independent degradation of a number of proteins , including SRC-3 , p21 , p16 and p53 and is involved in the regulation of chromosomal stability .
Moreover , the interaction of REGgamma with SIRT1 promotes its inhibition and Ub independent degradation .
Notably , we found that DBC1 ablation did not reduce apoptosis induction , contrary to previous reports , even though p53 acetylation and PUMA expression were reduced , and PARP cleavage induced .
Collectively , these data indicate that , at least in vitro , DBC1 and SIRT1 are not substrates of Chk2 kinase and that the N-terminus of DBC1 inhibits the activity of Chk2 by binding to its kinase domain .
To verify this , we initially set up in vitro kinase assays with recombinant GST-Chk2 and GST-DBC1 as substrate , and although GST-Chk2 was able to autophosphorylate and to target a GST-Cdc25C fragment , used as positive control , GST-DBC1 not only remained unphosphorylated , but quite surprisingly inhibited Chk2 activities .

Moreover , the interaction of REGgamma with SIRT1 promotes its inhibition and Ub independent degradation .
Curiously , when we analyzed the role of DBC1 in Chk2 induced apoptosis , we found that DBC1 depletion does not affect cell death , as previously reported , although it reduces p53 acetylation and PUMA induction , but not PARP1 cleavage . ++++ Active Chk2 thus amplifies the DDR signal and promotes transient cell cycle arrest to allow DNA repair or , in presence of irreparable damages , the induction of apoptosis . ++++ Since also ectopic Chk2 can promote apoptosis , we verified whether the DBC1 induced cell death might be attributed to an increased Chk2 activity . ++++ Active Chk2 thus amplifies the DDR signal and promotes transient cell cycle arrest to allow DNA repair or , in presence of irreparable damages , the induction of apoptosis .
Indeed we found that inactivation of Chk2 reduces DBC1-SIRT1 binding , thus preventing p53 acetylation and DBC1 induced apoptosis . ++++ In summary , we demonstrated that DBC1 promotes apoptosis by SIRT1 inhibition and that this phenomenon is regulated by the ATM-Chk2-REGgamma axis . ++++ Indeed , recently , other papers reported that DBC1 absence , in response to various stimuli , enhances cell death , thus supporting a model in which DBC1 can modulate apoptosis depending on the cellular context , type of damage and on the duration of genotoxic stress .

Curiously , we also found that Chk2 silencing prevents PUMA induction and Caspase-3 cleavage and that Chk2 depletion alone can not affect etoposide induced apoptosis . ++++ Alternatively , we can also suggest the existence of a Chk2 independent way to etoposide induced apoptosis , which does not require caspase-3 cleavage or the induction of PUMA protein .

Chk2 and REGgamma dependent DBC1 regulation in DNA damage induced apoptosis .
Curiously , when we analyzed the role of DBC1 in Chk2 induced apoptosis , we found that DBC1 depletion does not affect cell death , as previously reported , although it reduces p53 acetylation and PUMA induction , but not PARP1 cleavage . ++++ This route seems to be specifically based on the increase of p53 acetylation by DBC1 dependent SIRT1 inhibition .
Curiously , when we analyzed the role of DBC1 in Chk2 induced apoptosis , we found that DBC1 depletion does not affect cell death , as previously reported , although it reduces p53 acetylation and PUMA induction , but not PARP1 cleavage .
Concordant with these biochemical findings , the increased etoposide induced cell death , due to DBC1 overexpression , was antagonized by Chk2 ablation .
DBC1 mediated repression of SIRT1 results in increased levels of p53 acetylation and upregulation of p53 mediated apoptosis after DNA damage .
Curiously , when we analyzed the role of DBC1 in Chk2 induced apoptosis , we found that DBC1 depletion does not affect cell death , as previously reported , although it reduces p53 acetylation and PUMA induction , but not PARP1 cleavage .
As DBC1 induced p53 acetylation promotes p53 dependent transcriptional activity and apoptosis , we examined the effect of Chk2 depletion on these events . ++++ Indeed , although REGgamma was found not to be implicated in the regulation of SIRT1 activity towards p53 , in our cellular system we demonstrated that REGgamma and its phosphorylation on Ser247 by Chk2 are necessary for the DBC1 dependent increase of p53 acetylation , further corroborating the hypothesis that this proteasome activator subunit could be the missing link between DBC1 and Chk2 toward SIRT1 activity inhibition . ++++ The results showed that the catalytic activity of Chk2 is indispensable for DBC1 mediated induction of p53 acetylation and apoptosis . ++++ DBC1 mediated repression of SIRT1 results in increased levels of p53 acetylation and upregulation of p53 mediated apoptosis after DNA damage .
To determine whether Chk2 also phosphorylates REGgamma in vivo , cell extracts prepared from etoposide treated or untreated samples , with or without the Chk2 inhibitor VRX , were examined with the Phos-tag western blot technique . ++++ Additionally , we found that REGgamma , like Chk2 and DBC1-Thr454 phosphorylation , is required to increase DBC1-SIRT1 binding and SIRT1 activity inhibition and that REGgamma phosphorylation by Chk2 is necessary to increase REGgamma-DBC1 binding in response to DNA damage .
Thus , according to our model , following DNA damage ATM phosphorylates p53-S15 , DBC1-T454 and Chk2-T68 , inducing p53 stabilization , DBC1-SIRT1 binding and Chk2 activation and phosphorylation of REGgamma-Ser247 .
Similar experiments were performed to determine the role of Thr454 phosphorylation in Chk2 mediated increase of DBC1-SIRT1 association and we found that Chk2 overexpression can not induce the binding of DBC1-T454A to SIRT1 .
It should be noted however that , in cells , deletion of the N-terminus region of DBC1 ( a.a. 1-179 ) is sufficient to abolish DBC1 binding to Chk2 which maps on Chk2 catalytic domain .
Upon DNA damage , DBC1 is phosphorylated by ATM and ATR on Thr454 and this modification increases its inhibitory interaction with SIRT1 , leading to p53 acetylation and p53 dependent apoptosis .

Other in vitro Chk2 kinase assays performed with four DBC1 deletion fragments and full length SIRT1 showed no significant phosphorylation of these recombinant substrates , but they allowed to map the N-terminus sequence ( a.a. 1-229 ) of DBC1 as being responsible for the inhibition of Chk2 autophosphorylation and activity towards Cdc25C .
Moreover , DBC1-SIRT1 binding is negatively regulated by hMOF acetylation ( a member of the MYST family of histone acetyltransferases ) of specific DBC1 residues , a process inhibited by ATM upon DNA damage .
Thus , according to our model , following DNA damage ATM phosphorylates p53-S15 , DBC1-T454 and Chk2-T68 , inducing p53 stabilization , DBC1-SIRT1 binding and Chk2 activation and phosphorylation of REGgamma-Ser247 .
These events are mediated by Chk2 phosphorylation of the 11S proteasome activator REGgamma on Ser247 , which increases REGgamma-DBC1 interaction and SIRT1 inhibition .
Although DBC1 and SIRT1 protein levels were similar in all cell extracts , we found that etoposide treatment increased the amount of SIRT1 that co-immunoprecipitated with DBC1 , as already reported , but no increase was seen in Chk2 silenced cells .
Following DNA damage , ATM phosphorylates Chk2 on Thr68 , leading to its activation and phosphorylation of several substrates , including p53 , HDMX , PML , TRF2 and KAP1 .
Altogether , these findings suggest that Chk2 kinase promotes the physical association between DBC1 and SIRT1 in DNA damaged cells and , for this , the phosphorylation of DBC1 on Thr454 by ATM and ATR is also required .
However , although we noticed in Chk2 depleted cells reduced level of both PUMA protein and cleaved caspase-3 , as previously reported in , we curiously found that Chk2 depletion or chemical inhibition has no effect on etoposide induced p53 acetylation and apoptosis , as demonstrated by cleaved PARP1 levels and by the percentage of dead cells .
The potential role played by REGgamma in DBC1 dependent inhibition of SIRT1 was analyzed in DBC1 overexpressing U2OS cells transfected with siRNA against REGgamma or a control sequence , and the results showed that REGgamma depletion reduces the DBC1 dependent increase in p53 acetylation .
Moreover , when we overexpressed REGgamma WT or REGgamma S247A in control or Chk2 silenced U2OS cells , we detected an increase in p53 acetylation , upon etoposide , only with the ectopic wild-type protein and in Chk2 proficient cells , clearly indicating that SIRT1 inhibition by DBC1 requires REGgamma phosphorylated on S247 by Chk2 .
These results suggest that REGgamma-Ser247 phosphorylation by Chk2 can induce a conformational change in REGgamma protein that favors its binding to DBC1 .
Thus , according to our model , following DNA damage ATM phosphorylates p53-S15 , DBC1-T454 and Chk2-T68 , inducing p53 stabilization , DBC1-SIRT1 binding and Chk2 activation and phosphorylation of REGgamma-Ser247 .
These events are mediated by Chk2 phosphorylation of the 11S proteasome activator REGgamma on Ser247 , which increases REGgamma-DBC1 interaction and SIRT1 inhibition .
Thus , according to our model , following DNA damage ATM phosphorylates p53-S15 , DBC1-T454 and Chk2-T68 , inducing p53 stabilization , DBC1-SIRT1 binding and Chk2 activation and phosphorylation of REGgamma-Ser247 .
Although in unstressed cells neither DBC1 overexpression nor Chk2 depletion affected p53 acetylation ( data not shown ) , in etoposide treated cells DBC1 overexpression raised p53 acetylation in Chk2-proficient , but not in Chk2 depleted cells .
Together , these results indicate that DBC1 and REGgamma interact in human cells and that Chk2 can phosphorylate a fraction of the total pool of REGgamma in human cells on Ser 247 .
Thus , according to our model , following DNA damage ATM phosphorylates p53-S15 , DBC1-T454 and Chk2-T68 , inducing p53 stabilization , DBC1-SIRT1 binding and Chk2 activation and phosphorylation of REGgamma-Ser247 .
In accordance with this , we found that , upon DNA damage Chk2 phosphorylates REGgamma on Ser247 , both in vitro and in vivo , and that this modification promotes p53 acetylation , PUMA protein induction and apoptosis .
Thus , according to our model , following DNA damage ATM phosphorylates p53-S15 , DBC1-T454 and Chk2-T68 , inducing p53 stabilization , DBC1-SIRT1 binding and Chk2 activation and phosphorylation of REGgamma-Ser247 .
Rapamycin has also been reported to differentially regulate S6K1 in comparison with 4E-BP1 in various cell lines including HeLa , MEFs , and HEK293 , where rapamycin initially decreased 4E-BP1 phosphorylation but this decrease recovered within 6h while S6K1 phosphorylation continued to be inhibited and by 12h after treatment since 4E-BP1 was mostly hyperphosphorylated , it dissociated from eIF4E leading to a recovery in cap dependent translation even though S6K1 inhibition by rapamycin continued [ XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ More recently , we have reported that these phosphorylations might be coordinate instead of being sequential and the loss of these HM and AL phosphorylations is consequential and not because of inhibition of S6K1 by rapamycin [ XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ Rapamycin resistant phosphorylation of 4E-BP1 has been reported in regenerating rat livers where rapamycin inhibits activation of S6K1 in response to partial hepatectomy , but 4E-BP1 phosphorylation remains uninhibited , suggesting that the effect of rapamycin on 4E-BP1 function in vivo can be significantly different from its effect in cultured cells [ XREF_BIBR ] .
These studies with Torin suggest that rapamycin resistance of mTORC1 might be a general feature of a good number of mammalian systems [ XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ Rapamycin inhibits the mTORC1 activity since rapamycin bound to FKBP12 interacts with either free mTOR or mTOR in the mTORC1 complex causing conformational changes in mTORC1 which are responsible for rapamycin 's effect on mTORC1 targets [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Deptor and mLST8 are components of both mTOR complexes and whereas deptor negatively regulates mTORC1 as well as mTORC2 , mLST8 is essential only for mTORC2 function [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
Rheb activates mTORC1 but inhibits mTORC2 while TSC1/2 inhibits Rheb and mTORC1 but activates mTORC2 most likely by overcoming the negative feedback loop [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Also the phosphorylation of these sites is rather insensitive to rapamycin which could suggest that these phosphorylations are possibly mTOR independent however since these phosphorylations are inhibited by amino acids starvation of cells and by mTOR kinase inhibitors like wortmannin , activated by Rheb ( an mTOR activator ) , and are decreased in mTOR knockdown cells which suggests that the phosphorylation of these N-terminal residues is mediated by mTOR but through a raptor independent mechanism [ XREF_BIBR ] .
PI-103 and NVP-BEZ235 have been found to suppress AKT as well as S6K1 in breast tumors and leukemia cells [ XREF_BIBR ] , although some studies suggest that such broad inhibition of cellular signalling may also impair growth of normal cells [ XREF_BIBR ] .
The phosphorylation status of raptor governs mTORC1 activity since phosphorylation of raptor on S722/792 by 5 ' AMP activated kinase ( AMPK ) inhibits mTORC1 whereas mTOR mediated phosphorylation of raptor on S863 is crucial for the activation of mTORC1 in response to mitogen stimulation [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .

Deptor and mLST8 are components of both mTOR complexes and whereas deptor negatively regulates mTORC1 as well as mTORC2 , mLST8 is essential only for mTORC2 function [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
S6K1 inactivates eukaryotic elongation factor-2 kinase ( eEF2K ) which is a negative regulator of eukaryotic elongation factor 2 ( eEF2 ) , by phosphorylating it at S366 , and thus regulates the elongation step of translation [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Upon activation by growth factors , PI3K phosphorylates the D3 position of phosphatidylinositols producing the second messenger PtdIns ( 3,4,5 ) P3 that binds to the pleckstrin homology ( PH ) domain of AKT and translocates this kinase to the plasma membrane where it gets activated by upstream kinases [ XREF_BIBR ] .
mTOR inhibitors can be broadly grouped into two classes : the allosteric inhibitors of mTORC1 ( rapamycin and rapalogs ) and the mTOR kinase inhibitors .
Significant phosphorylation of 4E-BP1 at T37 and T46 and S65 is still observed in mTORC2 deficient Sin-1 knockout MEFs when treated with rapamycin , even though the hydrophobic motifs of both AKT and S6K1 are not phosphorylated due to absence of mTOR activity in both of its complexes .
mTOR Signaling in Protein Translation Regulation : Implications in Cancer Genesis and Therapeutic Interventions .
Rheb activates mTORC1 but inhibits mTORC2 while TSC1/2 inhibits Rheb and mTORC1 but activates mTORC2 most likely by overcoming the negative feedback loop [ XREF_BIBR ] .
This mTOR activation causes an increase in ribosome biogenesis that promotes cell proliferation by providing the machinery which is required by cells to maintain high levels of growth [ XREF_BIBR ] .
The activation of the tumour suppressor protein p53 induces a proteasome mediated specific cleavage of 4E-BP1 that gives rise to an N-terminally truncated , completely unphosphorylated and more stable form of 4E-BP1 that interacts with eIF4E in preference to full-length 4E-BP1 , which results in long-term unavailability of eIF4E , thereby contributing to the growth-inhibitory and proapoptotic effects of p53 [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
Dysregulated expression as well as increased phosphorylation of 4E-BPs in cancer also results in poor patient prognosis and the loss of 4E-BP1 with the resulting activation of cap dependent translation promotes cell-cycle progression and cell proliferation in culture [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] whereas overexpression of constitutively active 4E-BP1 suppresses tumor growth in vivo [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
The activation of the tumour suppressor protein p53 induces a proteasome mediated specific cleavage of 4E-BP1 that gives rise to an N-terminally truncated , completely unphosphorylated and more stable form of 4E-BP1 that interacts with eIF4E in preference to full-length 4E-BP1 , which results in long-term unavailability of eIF4E , thereby contributing to the growth-inhibitory and proapoptotic effects of p53 [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
Mutations in TSC1 or TSC2 cause tuberosis sclerosis [ XREF_BIBR ] , another familial cancer syndrome , and PTEN mutations result in Cowden 's syndrome [ XREF_BIBR ] .
During unfavourable conditions , such as cell starvation or rapamycin mediated inhibition of mTOR kinase , the Ulk1 complex is released from mTOR , thereby allowing it to associate with the membranes from which phagophores are formed [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Maf1 which is a Pol III repressor is inhibited by mTORC1 phosphorylation and thus induces 5S rRNA and tRNA transcription [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
Rheb activates mTORC1 but inhibits mTORC2 while TSC1/2 inhibits Rheb and mTORC1 but activates mTORC2 most likely by overcoming the negative feedback loop [ XREF_BIBR ] .
The activation of the tumour suppressor protein p53 induces a proteasome mediated specific cleavage of 4E-BP1 that gives rise to an N-terminally truncated , completely unphosphorylated and more stable form of 4E-BP1 that interacts with eIF4E in preference to full-length 4E-BP1 , which results in long-term unavailability of eIF4E , thereby contributing to the growth-inhibitory and proapoptotic effects of p53 [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
eIF4E promotes the translation of specific mRNAs that code for prooncogenic proteins which promote cell survival and cell-cycle progression , energy metabolism , and metastasis , thus affecting cell proliferation and tumorigenesis [ XREF_BIBR ] .
mTORC1 is activated by the PI3K and AKT pathway whereas TSC1-TSC2 ( tuberous sclerosis complex ) inhibits it [ XREF_BIBR ] .
The FATC domain is crucial for the kinase activity of mTOR since deletion of even a single amino acid from this domain inhibits mTOR kinase activity .
mTORC1 is activated by the PI3K and AKT pathway whereas TSC1-TSC2 ( tuberous sclerosis complex ) inhibits it [ XREF_BIBR ] .
mTOR induces autophagy in response to reduced growth factor signalling , starvation , and other metabolic and genotoxic stresses [ XREF_BIBR ] which leads to the formation of phagophores , inside which the lysosomal hydrolases degrade the targeted substrates [ XREF_BIBR ] .
In vitro , AZD8055 effectively inhibits cell proliferation and induces autophagy and , in vivo , AZD8055 inhibits tumor growth [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Mutations in TSC1 or TSC2 cause tuberosis sclerosis [ XREF_BIBR ] , another familial cancer syndrome , and PTEN mutations result in Cowden 's syndrome [ XREF_BIBR ] .
The regulatory element tripartite motif containing protein-24 ( TIF-1A ) is activated by mTORC1 , which enhances the expression of ribosomal RNA ( rRNA ) by promoting TIF-1A interaction with RNA Pol I [ XREF_BIBR ] .
mTORC1 phosphorylates 4E-BP1 at several residues which promotes the dissociation of eIF4E from 4E-BP1 consequently mitigating the inhibitory effect of 4E-BP1 on eIF4E dependent translation initiation whereas the inhibition of mTOR by rapamycin is believed to cause 4E-BP1 dephosphorylation , which results in inhibition of protein translation ( XREF_FIG ) [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Lipin-1 lowers SREBP1/2 levels inside the nucleus and mTORC1 mediated phosphorylation of Lipin-1 prevents it from entering the nucleus , thus suppressing this inhibition [ XREF_BIBR ] .
It is possible that rapamycin does not inhibit mTORC1 dependent phosphorylation of 4E-BP1 completely .
In AML , for example , the phosphorylation of S6K1 on T389 is abrogated by RAD001 while phosphorylation of 4E-BP1 on S65 residue remains unaffected , thus failing to inhibit mRNA translation and the assembly of eIF4F complexes [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Rapamycin has also been reported to differentially regulate S6K1 in comparison with 4E-BP1 in various cell lines including HeLa , MEFs , and HEK293 , where rapamycin initially decreased 4E-BP1 phosphorylation but this decrease recovered within 6h while S6K1 phosphorylation continued to be inhibited and by 12h after treatment since 4E-BP1 was mostly hyperphosphorylated , it dissociated from eIF4E leading to a recovery in cap dependent translation even though S6K1 inhibition by rapamycin continued [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Lipin-1 lowers SREBP1/2 levels inside the nucleus and mTORC1 mediated phosphorylation of Lipin-1 prevents it from entering the nucleus , thus suppressing this inhibition [ XREF_BIBR ] .
The N-terminus of S6K1 has a conserved TOR signaling ( TOS ) motif that interacts with raptor and enables mTORC1 mediated phosphorylation of S6K1 [ XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ The N-terminus of S6K1 has a conserved TOR signaling ( TOS ) motif that interacts with raptor and enables mTORC1 mediated phosphorylation of S6K1 [ XREF_BIBR ] .
S6K1 directly phosphorylates estrogen receptor ( ERalpha ) to stimulate its transcriptional activity in breast cancer cell lines [ XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ S6K1 directly phosphorylates estrogen receptor ( ERalpha ) to stimulate its transcriptional activity in breast cancer cell lines [ XREF_BIBR ] .
The mTORC2 substrate GSK3 ( glycogen synthase kinase 3 ) connects AKT to lipid synthesis since GSK phosphorylates lipogenic transcription factor SREBP ( sterol responsive element binding protein ) and targets it for protein degradation which is opposed by AKT mediated phosphorylation and inactivation of GSK . ++++ The mTORC2 substrate GSK3 ( glycogen synthase kinase 3 ) connects AKT to lipid synthesis since GSK phosphorylates lipogenic transcription factor SREBP ( sterol responsive element binding protein ) and targets it for protein degradation which is opposed by AKT mediated phosphorylation and inactivation of GSK .
The C-terminal region of S6K1 has an RSPRR motif which is important for the inhibitory role of this region , because a negative regulator of S6K1 binds to this motif [ XREF_BIBR ] and a deletion mutant of S6K1 lacking the C-terminal region is phosphorylated by mTORC2 [ XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ These molecules inhibit mTORC1 , mTORC2 , and PI3K , thus inhibiting the phosphorylation of AKT , S6K1 , and 4E-BP1 , and are therefore attractive drugs for targeting cancers driven by PI3K activation [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Rapamycin resistant phosphorylation of 4E-BP1 has been reported in regenerating rat livers where rapamycin inhibits activation of S6K1 in response to partial hepatectomy , but 4E-BP1 phosphorylation remains uninhibited , suggesting that the effect of rapamycin on 4E-BP1 function in vivo can be significantly different from its effect in cultured cells [ XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ Whether this Pim-2 kinase dependent and rapamycin insensitive phosphorylation of 4E-BP1 is carried out by a rapamycin insensitive mTORC1 complex or somehow by the mTORC2 complex is not known [ XREF_BIBR ] .
These molecules inhibit mTORC1 , mTORC2 , and PI3K , thus inhibiting the phosphorylation of AKT , S6K1 , and 4E-BP1 , and are therefore attractive drugs for targeting cancers driven by PI3K activation [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Two such inhibitors , PP242 and PP40 which inhibit the insulin stimulated S473 phosphorylation of AKT , also inhibit protein synthesis and cell proliferation [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Two such inhibitors , PP242 and PP40 which inhibit the insulin stimulated S473 phosphorylation of AKT , also inhibit protein synthesis and cell proliferation [ XREF_BIBR ] .
The insulin receptor substrate 1 ( IRS1 ) is directly phosphorylated by S6K1 at multiple sites which impairs its function and leads to inhibitory effects on the insulin-PI3K-AKT pathway .
mTOR kinase phosphorylates S6K1 at T389 which is the hydrophobic motif ( HM ) phosphorylation site [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] followed by the PDK1 mediated phosphorylation at T229 present in the activation loop ( AL ) which leads to full activation of S6K1 [ XREF_BIBR ] .
PDK1 phosphorylates AKT at T308 and mTORC2 phosphorylates it at S473 , both phosphorylations being necessary for the full activation of its kinase activity [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
During physiological conditions , the phagophore formation is inhibited by mTORC1 , since it directly interacts with and phosphorylates the Ulk1 kinase complex ( Ulk1-Atg13-FIP200-Atg101 ) which is required for the initiation of autophagy [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
The mTORC2 substrate GSK3 ( glycogen synthase kinase 3 ) connects AKT to lipid synthesis since GSK phosphorylates lipogenic transcription factor SREBP ( sterol responsive element binding protein ) and targets it for protein degradation which is opposed by AKT mediated phosphorylation and inactivation of GSK .
However , later studies showed that PRAS40 inhibits mTORC1 activity and is phosphorylated by mTORC1 on S183 when associated with mTORC1 via raptor and this binding is abolished by mutation of the S183 to aspartate [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
Also it is not clear whether the rapamycin sensitive sites of 4E-BP1 are directly phosphorylated by mTOR in vivo ; moreover some studies suggest that another unidentified 4E-BP1 kinase might exist [ XREF_BIBR ] .
PDK1 phosphorylates AKT at T308 and mTORC2 phosphorylates it at S473 , both phosphorylations being necessary for the full activation of its kinase activity [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
eIF4E is phosphorylated at S209 by mitogen activated protein kinase ( MAPK ) interacting protein kinase Mnk1/2 which uses a docking site in the carboxy-terminus of eIF4G to phosphorylate eIF4E , thus making it certain that eIF4E is phosphorylated only after the assembly of the eIF4F complex [ XREF_BIBR ] .
S6K1 also phosphorylates the p53 ubiquitin ligase , Mdm2 , on S166 [ XREF_BIBR ] and proapoptotic protein BAD , thus regulating cell survival [ XREF_BIBR ] .
These molecules inhibit mTORC1 , mTORC2 , and PI3K , thus inhibiting the phosphorylation of AKT , S6K1 , and 4E-BP1 , and are therefore attractive drugs for targeting cancers driven by PI3K activation [ XREF_BIBR ] .

In response to growth factors , AKT directly phosphorylates TSC2 on several distinct residues [ XREF_BIBR ] that prevents the formation of TSC1 and TSC2 complex , thus allowing GTPase Rheb to convert back into the GTP bound active state [ XREF_BIBR ] which leads to mTORC1 activation [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
Also it is not clear whether the rapamycin sensitive sites of 4E-BP1 are directly phosphorylated by mTOR in vivo ; moreover some studies suggest that another unidentified 4E-BP1 kinase might exist [ XREF_BIBR ] .
The phosphorylation status of raptor governs mTORC1 activity since phosphorylation of raptor on S722/792 by 5 ' AMP activated kinase ( AMPK ) inhibits mTORC1 whereas mTOR mediated phosphorylation of raptor on S863 is crucial for the activation of mTORC1 in response to mitogen stimulation [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .

Eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4B ( eIF4B ) is also phosphorylated by S6K1 and this phosphorylation promotes the recruitment of eIF4B to eukaryotic initiation factor 4A ( eIF4A ) at the translation initiation complex where it functions as a cofactor of eIF4A and increases its processivity [ XREF_BIBR ] .

The N-terminal region of p27 inhibits HIF-1alpha protein translation in ribosomal protein S6 dependent manner by regulating PHLPP-Ras-ERK-p90RSK axis . ++++ Subsequently , we used rapamycin to interfere with mTORC1 activity and found that it reduced HIF-1alpha induction in p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells ( XREF_FIG ) , indicating that p27 inhibited HIF-1alpha translation . ++++ In line with this , HIF-1alpha protein synthesis detected by pulse labeling assay was markedly repressed by the introduction of HA-S6 S235/236A in p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells ( XREF_FIG ) , suggesting that p27 inhibited HIF-1alpha translation in an S6-phosphorylation-dependent manner in arsenite response . ++++ P27 inhibited HIF-1alpha translation because of arsenite exposure .
Subsequently , we used rapamycin to interfere with mTORC1 activity and found that it reduced HIF-1alpha induction in p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells ( XREF_FIG ) , indicating that p27 inhibited HIF-1alpha translation . ++++ In line with this , HIF-1alpha protein synthesis detected by pulse labeling assay was markedly repressed by the introduction of HA-S6 S235/236A in p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells ( XREF_FIG ) , suggesting that p27 inhibited HIF-1alpha translation in an S6-phosphorylation-dependent manner in arsenite response . ++++ P27 inhibited HIF-1alpha translation because of arsenite exposure .
Our present study , for the first time to the best of our knowledge , revealed a potential role of p27 in inhibiting S6 mediated hypoxia inducible factor-1alpha ( HIF-1alpha ) protein translation , which contributed to the protection from environmental carcinogen ( sodium arsenite )-induced cell transformation . ++++ Further functional studies demonstrated that through inhibiting S6 mediated hypoxia inducible factor-1alpha ( HIF-1alpha ) translation , p27 contributed to the protection from environmental carcinogen ( sodium arsenite )-induced cell transformation .
In line with this , HIF-1alpha protein synthesis detected by pulse labeling assay was markedly repressed by the introduction of HA-S6 S235/236A in p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells ( XREF_FIG ) , suggesting that p27 inhibited HIF-1alpha translation in an S6-phosphorylation-dependent manner in arsenite response .

Further functional studies demonstrated that through inhibiting S6 mediated hypoxia inducible factor-1alpha ( HIF-1alpha ) translation , p27 contributed to the protection from environmental carcinogen ( sodium arsenite )-induced cell transformation .
To investigate whether arsenite could affect HIF-1alpha protein translation and whether inhibition of Raf/ERK/S6 pathway by p27 would attenuate it , we first checked HIF-1alpha induction by arsenite in p27 +/+ and p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells .
In addition , we performed Ras activity assay and found that in p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells Ras was kept in constitutively activated GTP bound form ( XREF_FIG ) , suggesting that p27 might target Ras for deactivation of the downstream kinases .
In line with this , HIF-1alpha protein synthesis detected by pulse labeling assay was markedly repressed by the introduction of HA-S6 S235/236A in p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells ( XREF_FIG ) , suggesting that p27 inhibited HIF-1alpha translation in an S6-phosphorylation-dependent manner in arsenite response .
48 In our current studies , we investigated the role of p27 in arsenite induced protein translation and its biological significance , as well as the underlying mechanisms .
The findings were further reproduced in shRNA p27 transfectants of both MEFs and Cl41 cells ( XREF_FIG ) , suggesting that arsenite induced activation of p70S6K was upregulated upon p27 depletion .
In line with this , HIF-1alpha protein synthesis detected by pulse labeling assay was markedly repressed by the introduction of HA-S6 S235/236A in p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells ( XREF_FIG ) , suggesting that p27 inhibited HIF-1alpha translation in an S6-phosphorylation-dependent manner in arsenite response .
As shown in XREF_FIG , the expression of full-length p27 was able to completely abrogate induction of phospho-S6 by arsenite , whereas transfection of C terminus of p27 ( aa 78-198 ) did not render the repressive effect , indicating that the N terminus of p27 ( aa 1-51 ) was critical for its inhibitory effect on S6 phosphorylation induced by arsenite .
As shown in XREF_FIG , the incorporation of 35 S-methionine and cysteine into newly synthesized HIF-1alpha protein was gradually increased along with the isotope incubation time in both p27 +/+ and p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells .
In our current studies , we found that arsenite induced phospho-AKT S473 was elevated in p27-/- cells and shRNA p27 transfectants when compared with that in wild-type and nonsense control cells , respectively ( XREF_FIG ) .
48 In our current studies , we investigated the role of p27 in arsenite induced protein translation and its biological significance , as well as the underlying mechanisms .
To show explicitly the role of S6 phosphorylation in HIF-1alpha protein translation under the control of the p27 signaling in arsenite response , we introduced S6 S235/236A double mutant , which specifically abolished phosphorylation of Ser235/236 in endogenous S6 .
More importantly , knockdown of HIF-1alpha efficiently reversed cell transformation of shRNA p27 cells ( XREF_FIG ) , suggesting that it might be through regulating HIF-1alpha protein expression that p27 achieved its inhibitory effect in arsenite induced cell transformation .
Thus , the results demonstrated that by deactivating Ras/Raf/MEK/ERK/p90RSK pathway , p27 inhibited arsenite induced S6 phosphorylation . ++++ Using these cells , we found that arsenite treatment caused a strong induction of phospho-S6 at S235/236 in p27-/- cells compared with that in p27 +/+ cells at all the time points tested ( 3-12h ) , regardless of the knockout methods used ( XREF_FIG , bottom panels ) , indicating that p27 might abrogate arsenite induced S6 phosphorylation at S235/236 .
As shown in XREF_FIG , the basal level of PHLPP was depleted in p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells , and arsenite treatment decreased PHLPP1 expression in p27 +/+ cells .
Consistently , stable transfection of another dominant mutant form of AKT , T308 and S473A , into p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells ( XREF_FIG ) was not able to decrease S6 phosphorylation ( XREF_FIG ) , but it could partially reduce phosphorylation of GSK3beta at S9 , a well-known downstream target of AKT ( XREF_FIG ) .
As shown in XREF_FIG ( lower panels ) , in both p70S6K-knockdown transfectants arsenite induced phosphorylation of p70S6K was apparently reduced but not that of S6 , indicating that p70S6K was not the upstream kinase that was responsible for the elevated S6 phosphorylation in p27 depleted cells in response to arsenite .
Although PI3K and AKT pathway was also involved in S6 activation , blocking AKT and p70S6K activation did not attenuate arsenite induced S6 activation in p27-/- cells , suggesting p27 specifically targeted Ras and ERK pathway rather than PI3K and AKT pathway for inhibition of S6 activation in response to arsenite exposure .
Therefore , we came to our final conclusion , as delineated in XREF_FIG , that by maintaining PHLPP expression , p27 blocked the activation of oncogenic Ras/Raf/MEK/ERK pathway in response to both acute and chronic arsenite exposure , led to inhibition of S6 activation in a p90RSK dependent manner and consequently attenuated protein translation of HIF-1alpha , a key transcription factor involved in chronic arsenite induced cell transformation .
AKT and p70S6K pathway was not responsible for hyperphosphorylation of S6 caused by p27 depletion .
Consistently , stable transfection of another dominant mutant form of AKT , T308 and S473A , into p27-/-( Delta51 ) cells ( XREF_FIG ) was not able to decrease S6 phosphorylation ( XREF_FIG ) , but it could partially reduce phosphorylation of GSK3beta at S9 , a well-known downstream target of AKT ( XREF_FIG ) .
Elevations of phospho-S6 at S235/236 were also observed in the stable transfectants of shRNA p27 generated from MEFs of different backgrounds and gestational ages , XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ( XREF_FIG ) as well as from mouse epidermal Cl41 cells ( XREF_FIG ) , indicating that the inhibitory effect of p27 on arsenite induced S6 phosphorylation at S235/236 was prevalent , which was neither cell type specific nor developmental stage dependent .
P27 inhibited arsenite induced ribosomal protein S6 phosphorylation .
Our findings showed that depletion of p27 expression by knockout and knockdown approaches efficiently enhanced S6 phosphorylation in arsenite response via overactivating Ras/Raf/MEK/ERK pathway , which consequently resulted in the stimulation of p90RSK ( 90kDa ribosomal S6 kinase ) , a direct kinase for S6 phosphorylation .

On the other hand , it reduced the accumulation of LC3-II caused by bafilomycin A1 , recapitulating the effect of U0126 on the autophagy flux in both IgR3 and Mel-RM cells , and the effect of PLX4720 in IgR3 cells .
Furthermore , the general caspase inhibitor z-VAD-fmk inhibited cell death at relatively early stages after withdrawal of serum [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Noticeably , PLX4720 decreased CREB activation ( phosphorylation ) in BRAF V600E melanoma cells .
To confirm that downregulation of Noxa by PLX4720 in BRAF V600E melanoma cells is due to inhibition of the MEK and ERK pathway , we treated IgR3 and MM200 ( BRAF V600E ) , and Mel-RM and ME4405 ( BRAF WT ) cells with the MEK inhibitor U0126 .
Inhibition of oncogenic BRAF V600E or MEK downregulated Noxa , whereas activation of MEK and ERK caused its upregulation .
U0126 abolished bafilomycin A1 triggered accumulation of LC3-II in both cell lines .
In line with this , knockdown of ERK1/2 with siRNA similarly caused downregulation of Noxa in both BRAF V600E and BRAF WT melanoma cells .
However , knockdown of Noxa enhanced proliferation of melanoma cells cultured under nutrient ( serum )-sufficient conditions .
Binding of Bcl-2 , Bcl-X L , or Mcl-1 with beclin-1 interferes with the association of beclin-1 with PIK3C3 and hVps34 thus inhibiting its autophagy inducing potential [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
Knockdown of Noxa inhibited activation of autophagy in melanoma cells under serum starvation conditions as shown by reduced LC3-II and elevated p62 levels .
Pro survival Bcl-2 family proteins negatively regulate autophagy by binding to beclin-1 , which plays an important role in autophagosome formation through forming complexes with Phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase catalytic subunit type 3 ( PIK3C3 )/mammalian vacuolar protein sorting 34 homologue ( hVps34 ) that is a nutrient regulated lipid kinase [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
Taken together , these results suggest that transcriptional upregulation of Noxa by MEK and ERK signaling is primarily mediated by CREB . ++++ Since Noxa is upregulated by activation of MEK and ERK , we examined whether Noxa is involved in induction of autophagy by MEK and ERK signaling . ++++ Nevertheless , upregulation of Noxa by MEK and ERK signaling in melanoma cells appeared largely due to a transcriptional increase , in that the Noxa mRNA was also increased similar to its protein , and that the turnover rate of the mRNA in melanoma cells remained similar to that in melanocytes . ++++ CREB mediates transcriptional upregulation of Noxa by MEK and ERK signaling . ++++ In this report , we present evidence that the BH3-only protein Noxa is upregulated by oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK signaling , and that Noxa plays an important role in regulation of autophagy in melanoma cells . ++++ Inhibition of oncogenic BRAF V600E or MEK downregulated Noxa , whereas activation of MEK and ERK caused its upregulation . ++++ To examine the mechanism responsible for transcriptional upregulation of Noxa by MEK and ERK signaling , we introduced luciferase reporter constructs of the Noxa promoter with deletions of the known binding site for p53 , E2F1 , or CREB into BRAF WT Mel-RM and ME4405 cells . ++++ To further consolidate that activation of the MEK and ERK pathway upregulates Noxa in melanocytic cells , we infected HEMn-MP human melanocytes with lentiviral constructs expressing BRAF V600E .
Activation of MEK and ERK drives autophagy in melanoma cells . ++++ Collectively , these results indicate that Noxa is required by autophagy driven by MEK and ERK signaling in melanoma cells . ++++ It is conceivable that Noxa may similarly activate autophagy triggered by oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK through displacement of Mcl-1 from beclin-1 , and that a dynamic balance between the Mcl-1 and Noxa and Mcl-1 and beclin-1 complexes contributes to regulation of autophagy and apoptosis in melanoma cells , in particular , when cells are under stress conditions such as nutrient starvation . ++++ Noxa is necessary for MEK and ERK driven autophagy in melanoma cells . ++++ These results reveal that oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK drives Noxa expression to promote autophagy , and suggest that Noxa has an indirect anti-apoptosis role in melanoma cells under nutrient starvation conditions .
These results reveal that oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK drives Noxa expression to promote autophagy , and suggest that Noxa has an indirect anti-apoptosis role in melanoma cells under nutrient starvation conditions . ++++ Noxa is necessary for MEK and ERK driven autophagy in melanoma cells . ++++ Collectively , these results indicate that Noxa is required by autophagy driven by MEK and ERK signaling in melanoma cells . ++++ It is conceivable that Noxa may similarly activate autophagy triggered by oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK through displacement of Mcl-1 from beclin-1 , and that a dynamic balance between the Mcl-1 and Noxa and Mcl-1 and beclin-1 complexes contributes to regulation of autophagy and apoptosis in melanoma cells , in particular , when cells are under stress conditions such as nutrient starvation . ++++ Since Noxa is upregulated by activation of MEK and ERK , we examined whether Noxa is involved in induction of autophagy by MEK and ERK signaling .
CREB mediates transcriptional upregulation of Noxa by MEK and ERK signaling . ++++ In support , knockdown of CREB abolished upregulation of endogenous Noxa by ectopic expression of BRAF V600E in Mel-RM cells . ++++ p53 independent induction of Noxa by CREB has also been previously reported [ XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ Although a number of transcription factors such as p53 and E2F1 are involved in transcriptional activation of Noxa [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] , we found that the transcription factor CREB is responsible for upregulation of Noxa by oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK in melanoma cells , whereas neither p53 nor E2F1 was involved .
Since Noxa is upregulated by activation of MEK and ERK , we examined whether Noxa is involved in induction of autophagy by MEK and ERK signaling . ++++ To further consolidate that activation of the MEK and ERK pathway upregulates Noxa in melanocytic cells , we infected HEMn-MP human melanocytes with lentiviral constructs expressing BRAF V600E . ++++ These results reveal that oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK drives Noxa expression to promote autophagy , and suggest that Noxa has an indirect anti-apoptosis role in melanoma cells under nutrient starvation conditions . ++++ In this report , we present evidence that the BH3-only protein Noxa is upregulated by oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK signaling , and that Noxa plays an important role in regulation of autophagy in melanoma cells .
In support , ectopic expression of BRAF V600E in Mel-RM cells increased accumulation of LC3-II induced by bafilomycin A1 . ++++ Similarly , PLX4720 inhibited the increase in LC3-II induced by bafilomycin A1 in IgR3 cells . ++++ U0126 abolished bafilomycin A1 triggered accumulation of LC3-II in both cell lines . ++++ On the other hand , it reduced the accumulation of LC3-II caused by bafilomycin A1 , recapitulating the effect of U0126 on the autophagy flux in both IgR3 and Mel-RM cells , and the effect of PLX4720 in IgR3 cells .
Since Mcl-1 that can bind to and inhibit Noxa is also increased with melanoma progression [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] , and the ability of Noxa to trigger apoptosis is determined by a balance between its expression levels and the levels of Mcl-1 [ XREF_BIBR ] , it seems that high expression of Mcl-1 is sufficient to enable melanoma cells to withstand similarly high levels of Noxa . ++++ Since Mcl-1 that can bind to and inhibit Noxa is also increased with melanoma progression [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] , and the ability of Noxa to trigger apoptosis is determined by a balance between its expression levels and the levels of Mcl-1 [ XREF_BIBR ] , it seems that high expression of Mcl-1 is sufficient to enable melanoma cells to withstand similarly high levels of Noxa .
However , we have found that the expression of the other BH3-only protein Noxa is commonly upregulated in melanoma cells , and that this is driven by oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK . ++++ In this report , we present evidence that the BH3-only protein Noxa is upregulated by oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK signaling , and that Noxa plays an important role in regulation of autophagy in melanoma cells .
In addition , we demonstrate that Noxa is necessary for induction of autophagy that delays apoptosis in melanoma cells under nutrient starvation conditions . ++++ It is conceivable that Noxa may similarly activate autophagy triggered by oncogenic activation of MEK and ERK through displacement of Mcl-1 from beclin-1 , and that a dynamic balance between the Mcl-1 and Noxa and Mcl-1 and beclin-1 complexes contributes to regulation of autophagy and apoptosis in melanoma cells , in particular , when cells are under stress conditions such as nutrient starvation .

We found that Chk2 deficiency partially rescues both Terc deficiency in early generations and Trf1 deficiency associated phenotypes , thus demonstrating a role for Chk2 in signaling telomere dysfunction in vivo . ++++ The findings described here indicate that Chk2 abrogation can partially rescue both survival and some of the phenotypes associated to both Terc and Trf1 deficiencies , revealing a potential for Chk2 inhibition in ameliorating phenotypes associated to both critically short telomeres and severe telomere dysfunction . ++++ To further investigate how Chk2 deficiency could rescue both the severity of the skin pathologies and survival of Trf1 Delta and Delta K5Cre Chk2 -/- mice compared to Trf1 Delta and Delta K5Cre littermates , we first set to quantify DNA damage in the skin of these mice by determining the number of cells showing DNA damage foci as indicated by staining with gammaH2Ax and 53BP1 . ++++ Interestingly , Chk2 deficiency significantly rescued the survival of Trf1 Delta and Delta K5Cre mice , with one doubly deficient mice surviving for as long as 1 year of age compared to a maximum survival of 4 days for single Trf1 deficient littermates . ++++ Chk2 deficiency rescues mouse survival and degenerative pathologies in Trf1 deficient mice .
Both CHK1 and CHK2 can activate p53 upon DNA damage and are important for cell cycle checkpoints , however , while CHK1 is crucial for intra-S and G2/S transition , CHK2 is more important for G1/S checkpoint . ++++ Altogether , these results demonstrate that Chk2 deletion attenuates induction of p53 and p21 as well as rescues proliferative defects in the skin of Trf1 Delta and Delta K5Cre mice , which in turn leads to a partial rescue of survival but also to increased tumorigenesis .

Interestingly , abrogation of other components of the DDR , such as p21 , Pms2 and Exo-1 , can rescue survival of Terc deficient mice without increasing cancer .
p53 deficiency can rescue both survival and tumorigenesis in Terc -/- p53 -/- mice , indicating that p53 is one of the main downstream mediators of the cellular response to DDR triggered by short telomeres .
This fact also explains that Chk2 deficiency only partially rescued survival and phenotypes associated to Trf1 deficiency , while p53 deficiency was previously described by us to fully rescue Trf1 Delta and Delta K5-Cre perinatal lethality .
p53 deficiency can rescue both survival and tumorigenesis in Terc -/- p53 -/- mice , indicating that p53 is one of the main downstream mediators of the cellular response to DDR triggered by short telomeres .
Chk2 deficiency reduces p53 induction and increases proliferation of the skin of K5Cre Trf1 Delta and Delta Chk2 -/- newborns .
Interestingly , at 9 days of age , at which point all single mutant Trf1 Delta and Delta K5Cre mice were dead , surviving Trf1 Delta and Delta K5Cre Chk2 -/- mice showed extensive dysplasia in the skin , suggesting an increased preneoplastic growth associated to massive Trf1 induced DNA damage in the absence of Chk2 .
Both CHK1 and CHK2 can activate p53 upon DNA damage and are important for cell cycle checkpoints , however , while CHK1 is crucial for intra-S and G2/S transition , CHK2 is more important for G1/S checkpoint .
Furthermore , abolishment of end-to-end fusions owing to Trf1 deficiency by simultaneously deleting 53 bp1 , and essential component of the NHEJ , does not inhibit Chk2 phosphorylation or ' in vivo ' G2/M arrest .
Interestingly , it has been recently shown that deletion of Trf1 induces phosphorylation of both the ATR and ATM downstream kinases CHK1 and CHK2 , respectively , suggesting that both checkpoint kinases may be important to mediate telomere dysfunction owing to telomere uncapping .
showed that TRF2 depletion leads to CHK2 phosphorylation and to G2/M arrest , preventing fusions and genome instability .
Interestingly , it has been recently shown that deletion of Trf1 induces phosphorylation of both the ATR and ATM downstream kinases CHK1 and CHK2 , respectively , suggesting that both checkpoint kinases may be important to mediate telomere dysfunction owing to telomere uncapping .
Conditional Trf1deletion in MEFs by adenoviral infection with the Cre recombinase induces Chk2 phosphorylation .
In the case of the mouse , we have previously shown that dysfunctional telomeres induced by Trf1 deletion lead to Chk2 phosphorylation and G2/M arrest .
FAT4 suppresses the activity of the Hippo effector YAP and TAZ . ++++ Thus , FAT4 may negatively regulate YAP and TAZ function by modulating actin cytoskeletal tension . ++++ Additionally , we show that siRNA mediated FAT4 knockdown induced the activity of the Hippo effector YAP and TAZ in MCF-10A cells . ++++ Altogether , our current study presents a novel model in which FAT4 represses YAP and TAZ activity by regulating actin structures , at least in breast cancer cells . ++++ Taken together , our results may suggest that FAT4 represses YAP and TAZ activity by regulating actin structures . ++++ Finally , we demonstrate that FAT4 represses YAP and TAZ activity in MCF-10A cells .
Thus , FAT4 may negatively regulate YAP and TAZ function by modulating actin cytoskeletal tension . ++++ Taken together , our results may suggest that FAT4 represses YAP and TAZ activity by regulating actin structures . ++++ Phalloidin staining revealed that FAT4 knockdown induced abnormal spiny actin structures that radiated in all directions from the cells ( XREF_FIG and XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY . ) ++++ In fact , we show that FAT4 knockdown induces abnormal spiny actin protrusions , which may enhance cell spreading ( XREF_FIG ) . ++++ Altogether , our current study presents a novel model in which FAT4 represses YAP and TAZ activity by regulating actin structures , at least in breast cancer cells .

Src has been shown to elicit Cofilin mediated disruption of the actin cytoskeleton through the MEK and Erk pathway [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Under this condition , U0126 significantly inhibited both Src induced actin dynamics ( XREF_FIG ) and the dephosphorylation of Cofilin ( XREF_FIG ) . ++++ Src activates Cofilin via dephosphorylation by components of the MEK and Erk pathway ( XREF_FIG ) and thereby induces actin depolymerization ( XREF_FIG ) . ++++ Src activation causes actin depolymerization via the MEK/Erk/Cofilin cascade . ++++ Src mediated actin depolymerization is regulated by the MEK/Erk/Cofilin1 cascade and results in the repression of FAT4 mRNA expression . ++++ Therefore , Src induced actin depolymerization has been speculated to repress FAT4 mRNA expression via DNMT1 induced promoter hypermethylation during carcinogenesis , but further studies are needed for clarification .
These results are consistent with those of a recent study that demonstrated Drosophila Src64B activates Yorkie , the mammalian Yap and Taz homologue , by repressing the core components of the Hippo pathway ( Hippo and Warts ) [ XREF_BIBR ] .

When rapamycin inhibits mTOR relocation to mitochondria , removing its interaction with HK II , HK II can then interact with MnSOD , inhibiting its function after irradiation , as seen in XREF_FIG . ++++ Our results provide a mechanism for such sensitization whereby rapamycin treatment before radiation can prevent the relocation of mTOR to mitochondria . ++++ Inhibition of mTOR by rapamycin blocked radiation induced mTOR mitochondrial relocation and the shift of glycolysis to mitochondrial respiration , and reduced the clonogenic survival .
In support of this argument we showed that 3-BrPA , an HK II inhibitor , can prevent the binding of HK II to mitochondria and inhibit its activity in glycolysis .
Tumor Cells Switch to Mitochondrial Oxidative Phosphorylation under Radiation via mTOR Mediated Hexokinase II Inhibition - A Warburg Reversing Effect .
The inhibition of HK II function can slow down the aerobic glycolysis and increase OXPHOS activity which is required to increase tumor cell survival under genotoxic stress conditions .
We co-immunoprecipitated HK II and MnSOD in MCF-7 cells treated with rapamycin and/or radiation ( XREF_FIG ) and found that at 24 h post-irradiation , relocation of mTOR to mitochondria can prevent the influx of HK II into the mitochondrial matrix to form a complex with MnSOD .

Next , we tested whether blocking mTOR could inhibit mTOR mediated mitochondrial bioenergetics . ++++ The relocation of mTOR is critical for the adaptive switch of bioenergetics in tumors enabling them to survive genotoxic stress .
Interestingly , mTOR has been detected on the mitochondria surface [ XREF_BIBR ] , and inhibition of mTOR can decrease the function of mitochondrial metabolism such as oxygen consumption , mitochondrial membrane potential and the TCA cycle [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ The mTOR mediated metabolism switch in cancer cells provides a novel focus for the dynamic reprogramming of cellular bioenergetics .

Three tumor cell lines ( breast cancer MCF-7 , colon cancer HCT116 and glioblastoma U87 ) showed a quick relocation of mTOR to mitochondria after irradiation with a single dose 5 Gy , which was companied with decreased lactate production , increased mitochondrial ATP generation and oxygen consumption .

In XREF_FIG , our clonogenic survival experiment showed that rapamycin treated cells had a lower survival , potentially caused by the influx of HK II into the mitochondrial matrix .
We co-immunoprecipitated HK II and MnSOD in MCF-7 cells treated with rapamycin and/or radiation ( XREF_FIG ) and found that at 24 h post-irradiation , relocation of mTOR to mitochondria can prevent the influx of HK II into the mitochondrial matrix to form a complex with MnSOD .
The inhibition of HK II function can slow down the aerobic glycolysis and increase OXPHOS activity which is required to increase tumor cell survival under genotoxic stress conditions .
By blocking the interaction between HK II and MnSOD , mTOR enables the proper activation of MnSOD , which is required to scavenge elevated ROS resulting from enhanced OXPHOS .
HK II is highly activated in cancer cells and is located on the outer membrane of mitochondria where it phosphorylates glucose in the first step of glycolysis [ XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ HK II is in the first step of aerobic glycolysis ; it is located on the outer membrane of mitochondria and phosphorylates glucose to glucose-6-phosphate .
Therefore , mTOR may be able to phosphorylate HK II and regulate its activity .

This in turn enables activation of CDK2 and cyclin E , which further phosphorylates Rb , thereby promoting complete release of E2F factors , inducing their maximal action as transcriptional activators and facilitating progression through G1 [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .

Inactivation of mTOR , with siRNA or an mTORC1/2 kinase inhibitor , prevented DNA damage induced S and G2/M cell cycle arrest as well as Chk1 activation , demonstrating a requirement of mTOR for cell survival by establishing efficient cell cycle arrest . ++++ Indeed , our results show that inhibition of mTOR by both siRNA and a specific inhibitor caused a striking inhibition of etoposide induced S and G2/M cell cycle arrest . ++++ We show that inactivation of mTOR with siRNA or pharmacological inhibition of mTORC1/2 kinase prevents etoposide induced S and G2/M cell cycle arrest .
However , in cells that depend on alternative apoptotic pathways and/or rely on mTORC2-Chk1 for cell cycle arrest , then by preventing appropriate cell cycle checkpoints , mTOR inhibition can augment cell death . ++++ In HEK293 cells , the inhibition of mTOR activity using both PP242 and siRNA led to an increase in etoposide induced cell death , as evidenced from the increase in the sub G1 population .

Collectively these results show that in all cell lines used in this study and by two different types of DNA damage induction , and two different types of mTOR inhibition , all three DNA damage induced phosphoryations of Chk1 require mTOR activity .

While there is evidence that DNA damage eventually leads to mTORC1 inhibition through p53 dependent mechanisms [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] , there are also an increasing number of reports demonstrating that mTORC1 positively regulates p53 , [ XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR ] and that both mTORC1 and mTORC2 pathways are activated following DNA damage [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR ] .

These results are consistent with a previous report demonstrating a requirement of ATM for the initial transient increase in protein synthesis induced by DNA damage that was mediated by mTORC1 [ XREF_BIBR ] .
Taken together , our results show that etoposide induced increase in mTOR is independent of p53 , but dependent on ATM and ATR activity .

mTOR regulates Chk1 production following etoposide induced DNA damage .
Consistent with our previous results , western blot analysis revealed that etoposide induced Chk1 phosphorylation was strikingly inhibited by PP242 in all breast cell lines tested . ++++ Furthermore , in other breast cancer cell lines ( HBL100 , MDA-MB-231 and HCC1937 ) , PP242 and mTOR siRNA treatment in HBL100 cells inhibited all three Chk1 phosphorylations induced by etoposide .
In line with this , recent work has demonstrated that cisplatin induced apoptosis was significantly increased by loss of Rictor but not Raptor in breast and ovarian cancer cells [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] .
Consequently , in cells that undergo DNA damage induced p53 dependent cell death , mTOR ablation could prevent p53 mediated cell death .
Collectively , these results demonstrate that inhibition of mTOR activity significantly potentiates etoposide mediated cell death in breast cancer , suggesting that breast cancer cells may rely on the mTORC2-Chk1 pathway for survival .

Furthermore , the phospho deficient T205A FBW7 mutant is resistant to ERK activation and could significantly suppress pancreatic cancer cell proliferation and tumorigenesis .
We found that decreased IHC signal of FBW7 correlated with poor tumor differentiation ( XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY ; P = 0.017 ) .
These results collectively demonstrate how the oncogenic KRAS mutation inhibits the tumor suppressor FBW7 , thus revealing an important function of KRAS mutations in promoting pancreatic cancer progression .
These results suggest that activation of the Ras/Raf/MEK/ERK pathway negatively regulates FBW7 stability in pancreatic cancer cells .
As expected , in the current study , we found that FBW7 levels are inversely correlated with ERK activation in PDAC . ++++ Taken together , these results suggest that the abundance of FBW7 inversely correlates with ERK activation in PDAC .
Similarly , downregulation of endogenous ERK1 by shRNA constructs significantly increased the abundance of FBW7 in SW1990 cells ( XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY ) .
Overall , oncogenic KRAS signaling in PDAC is through three major pathways : Raf/MEK/ERK , PI3K/Pdk1/Akt and the Ral guanine nucleotide exchange factor pathway 25 .

Additionally , the phosphorylation of FBW7 by ERK was abolished by calf intestinal phosphatase ( CIP ) treatment ( XREF_FIG ) , indicating that ERK kinase modulates FBW7 in a phosphorylation dependent manner . ++++ To further understand how ERK kinase phosphorylates FBW7 in vivo , we developed a specific antibody that only recognizes FBW7 phosphorylated at the T205 site . ++++ ERK kinase phosphorylates and destabilizes the tumor suppressor FBW7 in pancreatic cancer . ++++ To prove that ERK kinase directly phosphorylates FBW7 , glutathione S-transferase ( GST )-fused recombinant FBW7 proteins , both wild type and T205A mutant , were incubated with purified HA-ERK1 kinase in the presence of ATP and detected with the p-FBW7 antibody . ++++ Next , we investigated whether ERK kinase directly phosphorylates FBW7 , as they physically interact .

Thus , we hypothesized that ERK kinase promotes FBW7 ubiquitination in a Pin1 dependent manner . ++++ Together , these data strongly suggest that ERK kinase promotes FBW7 ubiquitination in a T205 phosphorylation- and Pin1 dependent manner .
We further showed that ERK directly interacted with FBW7 and phosphorylated FBW7 at Thr205 , which sequentially promoted FBW7 ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation . ++++ We demonstrate that ERK kinase directly interacts with and phosphorylates FBW7 at Thr205 , which leads to the ubiquitination and proteosomal degradation of FBW7 itself and the elevation of multiple FBW7 substrates , such as c-Myc , thus facilitating the proliferation and survival of pancreatic cancer cells .
Moreover , depletion of endogenous ERK1 and ERK2 by siRNA transfection or trametinib treatment significantly reduced the ubiquitination of FBW7 ( XREF_FIG and XREF_FIG ) , indicating an important role for ERK kinase in regulating FBW7 ubiquitination .
Notably , co-transfection of a constitutively active form of MEK1 ( MEK1-CA ) or ERK1 kinase dramatically increased the phosphorylation of wild-type FBW7 but not the T205A mutant , suggesting that MAPK kinase signaling indeed controls FBW7 phosphorylation status ( XREF_FIG and XREF_FIG ) .
We further showed that ERK directly interacted with FBW7 and phosphorylated FBW7 at Thr205 , which sequentially promoted FBW7 ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation .
Before our study , a report demonstrated that Pin1 , the only peptidyl-prolyl cis/trans isomerase , interacts with FBW7 in a phospho-T205-dependent manner and promotes FBW7 self ubiquitination and protein degradation 21 .
We further showed that ERK directly interacted with FBW7 and phosphorylated FBW7 at Thr205 , which sequentially promoted FBW7 ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation .
First , we observed that wild-type HA-ERK1 , but not kinase dead mutant , greatly increased the poly-ubiquitination of WT-FBW7 but not the T205A mutant ( XREF_FIG and XREF_FIG ) .
Furthermore , co-transfection of Kras G12D also significantly promoted the ubiquitination of FBW7 ( XREF_FIG ) .
Moreover , depletion of endogenous ERK1 and ERK2 by siRNA transfection or trametinib treatment significantly reduced the ubiquitination of FBW7 ( XREF_FIG and XREF_FIG ) , indicating an important role for ERK kinase in regulating FBW7 ubiquitination .
In summary , by exploring signaling pathways unique to PDAC and absent from other types of cancer , we demonstrated for the first time that the oncogenic KRAS-MAPK signaling cascade , one of the major driving forces for PDAC progression , phosphorylates the tumor suppressor FBW7 at the T205 site and promotes FBW7 ubiquitination and destruction .
Together , these data strongly suggest that ERK kinase promotes FBW7 ubiquitination in a T205 phosphorylation- and Pin1 dependent manner .

Indeed , depletion of endogenous Pin1 by siRNA drastically reversed the ERK promoted poly-ubiquitination of FBW7 ( XREF_FIG ) .
In summary , by exploring signaling pathways unique to PDAC and absent from other types of cancer , we demonstrated for the first time that the oncogenic KRAS-MAPK signaling cascade , one of the major driving forces for PDAC progression , phosphorylates the tumor suppressor FBW7 at the T205 site and promotes FBW7 ubiquitination and destruction .
Therefore , through the phosphorylation and inhibition of FBW7 , the KRAS-MAPK axis may mainly rescue c-Myc expression to trigger a major alteration in the transcription profile towards malignancy and cell growth advantage .

PD induced autophagy . ++++ Subsequently , we used insulin to further clarify the correlation between insulin mediated activation of the PI3K/Akt/mTOR pathway and PD induced autophagy . ++++ Taken together , these results demonstrated that PD induced autophagy in NCI-H460 and A549 cells through activation of p-p38 MAPK and p-JNK , while inhibition of p-Erk1/2 was not responsible for PD induced autophagy . ++++ Additionally , the effects assessed with a panel of pharmacologic inhibitors , including U0126 ( Erk1/2 kinase inhibitor ) , SP600125 ( JNK kinase inhibitor ) and SB203580 ( p38 MAPK kinase inhibitor ) suggested that the activation of JNK and p38 MAPK participated in PD induced autophagy . ++++ Taken together , it was clearly suggested that PD induced autophagy in NCI-H460 and A549 cells by inhibiting the PI3K/Akt/mTOR signaling pathway . ++++ Collectively , these results provided evidence that PD induced autophagy in NCI- H460 and A549 cell lines . ++++ To further clarify Beclin-1 . ++++ However , whether PD induces autophagy in both cell lines and its molecular mechanisms have not been elucidated . ++++ Further detection of the PI3K/Akt/mTOR signaling pathway compared p-Akt ( Ser473 ) , p-p70S6K ( Thr389 ) and p-4EBP1 ( Thr37/46 ) in both cell lines . ++++ PD induced autophagy in NCI-H460 and A549 cells . ++++ In this study , we aimed to investigate the effects of PD induced autophagy in NCI-H460 and A549 cell lines and its underlying mechanisms focusing on the role of PI3K/Akt/mTOR and MAPK signaling pathways in PD induced autophagy . ++++ Our results indicated that PD induced autophagy as evidence by increasing the conversion of LC3-I to LC3-II and the accumulation of Atg-3 , Atg-7 and Beclin-1 in a dose- and time dependent manner . ++++ These results suggested that PD induced autophagy in NCI-H460 and A549 cells was associated with the inhibition of PI3K/Akt/mTOR signaling pathway . ++++ Our preliminary studies have demonstrated that PD has an anti-NSCLC effect associated with the induction of apoptosis , however , whether PD induces autophagy in NSCLC cells has yet to be identified . ++++ To further clarify whether PD induced autophagy was connected with p-p38 MAPK and p-JNK activation and p-Erk1/2 suppression , cells were pretreated with the pharmacological inhibitors SB203580 , SP600125 or U0126 respectively , and then with U0126 group was lower than that treated by PD alone , indicating that p-Erk1/2 was not responsible for PD mediated autophagy . ++++ Collectively , these results provided obvious evidence that PD induced autophagy in NCI-H460 and A549 cells . ++++ To investigate the role of MAPK signaling pathways in PD induced autophagy , the activation of JNK , Erk1/2 and p38 MAPK was examined by Western blot assay using phosphorylated antibodies specific for the active forms of these kinases . ++++ In conclusion , our experiments provided the first evidence that PD induced autophagy via inhibiting the PI3K/Akt/mTOR signaling pathway and activating JNK and p38 MAPK signaling pathways in NSCLC cells . ++++ In accordance with these findings , our results demonstrated the activation of JNK and p38 MAPK was involved in PD induced autophagy in NCI-H460 and A549 cells . ++++ In this study , we aimed to investigate the effects of PD induced autophagy in NCI-H460 and A549 cell lines and its underlying mechanisms focusing on the role of PI3K/Akt/mTOR and MAPK signaling pathways in PD induced autophagy .
And our previous studies had found PD significantly inhibited cell proliferation and viability in NSCLC cell lines NCI-H460 and A549 in a dose- and time dependent manner , and it induced apoptosis through mitochondrial dependent and Erk signaling pathways ( under submitting ) . ++++ Currently , it has been reported that PD effectively induces apoptosis in many cancer cells XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR .
Further detection of the PI3K/Akt/mTOR signaling pathway compared to LY294002 ( PI3K kinase inhibitor ) , RAP ( mTOR kinase inhibitor ) and insulin ( an activator of PI3K/Akt/mTOR signaling pathway ) showed that PD induced autophagy through inhibiting the pathway at p-Akt ( Ser473 ) , p-p70S6K ( Thr389 ) and p-4EBP1 ( Thr37/46 ) in both cell lines . ++++ Subsequently , we used insulin to further clarify the correlation between insulin mediated activation of the PI3K/Akt/mTOR pathway and PD induced autophagy .
To further clarify whether PD induced autophagy depended on p-p38 MAPK and p-JNK activation and p-Erk1/2 suppression , cells were treated with U0126 ( an inhibitor of Erk1/2 ) , SP600125 ( an inhibitor of JNK ) or SB203580 ( an inhibitor of p38 ) for 4 h followed by treatment with or without PD for 24h .
Among them , phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase/protein kinase B/mammalian target of rapamycin ( PI3K/Akt/mTOR ) and mitogen activated protein kinase ( MAPK ) signaling pathways especially play a critical role in regulating establishment of autophagy in cancer cells XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR .

In tumor cells inhibiting CDK4 can induce senescence [ XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR ] or quiescence [ XREF_BIBR ] depending on the cell type . ++++ CDK4 inhibition can induce senescence in a subset of Rb positive liposarcoma cell lines . ++++ Thus we accomplished what we set out to do -- identify determinants that can distinguish whether CDK4 inhibition will induce quiescence or senescence , and in so doing we have unexpectedly identified two new molecular players ( ATRX and MDM2 ) and an event ( MDM2 turnover ) regulating geroconversion .

Similar to what we saw in WD/DDLS cells , enforced MDM2 expression did not affect PD0332991 induced cell cycle exit , but did prevent the accumulation of SA-beta-gal . ++++ All underwent PD0332991 induced cell cycle exit within 24 hours , and MDM2 levels decreased in all except for H358 , H3122 and Calu-1 .
In this report , using well differentiated and dedifferentiated liposarcoma ( WD/DDLS ) cell lines , we show that the proteolytic turnover of MDM2 is required for CDK4i induced senescence . ++++ CDK4i induced senescence associated with loss of MDM2 is also observed in some breast cancer , lung cancer and glioma cell lines indicating that this is not limited to WD/DDLS cells in which MDM2 is overexpressed or in cells that contain wild type p53 .
Because MDM2 is not overexpressed in SNB19 cells , it suggested that senescence mediated by MDM2 down regulation in response to CDK4i was not unique to those cells in which MDM2 is amplified .
Similar results were seen in LS0082 and SNB19 glioma cells -- knocking down ATRX prevented CDK4 inhibitor induced senescence and MDM2 levels did not decrease .
Thus , the senescence machinery was intact in non responders , however , CDK4 inhibition induced cell cycle exit could not drive reduction of MDM2 in these cells .
Thus , we suspect that C-terminal modifications of ATRX may affect its activity in CDK4 inhiibitor induced senescence but not its role in telomere maintenance .

Thus , it is clear that rapamycin induces a GSK3 dependent reduction of cyclin D1 , c-Myc and Mcl-1 , likely independent of translation regulation . ++++ It is known that the E3 ubiquitin ligase FBX4 is involved in mediating GSK3 dependent degradation of cyclin D1 [ XREF_BIBR ] and FBXW7 mediates GSK3 dependent degradation of both c-Myc and Mcl-1 [ XREF_BIBR , XREF_BIBR ] . ++++ Collectively , these results demonstrate that rapamycin induces FBX4 dependent degradation of cyclin D1 and FBXW7 mediated degradation of c-Myc and Mcl-1 , furthering the notion that rapamycin induces GSK3 dependent degradation of cyclin D1 , c-Myc and Mcl-1 . ++++ Accordingly we suggest that rapalogs , like mTOR kinase inhibitors [ XREF_BIBR ] , induce GSK3 dependent degradation of cyclin D1 through inhibition of mTORC2 . ++++ We were interested in knowing how inhibition of GSK3 blocks rapamycin induced reduction of cyclin D1 , c-Myc and Mcl-1 without interfering with the suppression of mTORC1 signaling and cap binding by rapamycin . ++++ Our findings are in fact in agreement with a previous report that rapamycin induces GSK3 dependent degradation of cyclin D1 in human breast cancer cell lines [ XREF_BIBR ] .

To understand the mechanism by which GSK3 activity regulates cell response to rapalogs , we then determined whether GSK3 inhibition interferes with the ability of rapamycin to inhibit the mTORC1 signaling and cap dependent translation given the general thought that rapamycin primarily inhibits mTORC1 . ++++ To our surprise , we detected reduced levels of not only raptor as expected , but also rictor from IP complexes in all 7 cell lines , indicating that rapamycin disrupts the assembly of both mTORC1 and mTORC2 in these cell lines .
